definition: to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon

sentences.english: A coronal mass ejection can cause problems on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 日冕物质抛射可能对地球造成各种影响。

sentences.english: She would be able to launch seaplanes by using light jettisonable trolleys .
sentences.chinese: 它能用轻便的抛射推车发射水上飞机。

sentences.english: The results demonstrated the main observed characteristics of the loop-like coronal mass ejection.
sentences.chinese: 模拟结果再现了环状日冕物质抛射的主要观测特征。

sentences.english: She would be able to launch seaplanes by using light jettisonable trolleys.
sentences.chinese: 它能用轻便的抛射推车发射水上飞机。

sentences.english: At what precise moment will the moon be in the most favourable position to be reached by the projectile ?
sentences.chinese: 月球在什么时候出现在抛射体最容易击中的位置上？

sentences.english: These are called coronal mass ejections.
sentences.chinese: 这被称为日冕物质抛射。

sentences.english: These tags dictate where the projectile will be launched.
sentences.chinese: 这些标签法则了抛射体发射的坐标。

sentences.english: The vertical and horizontal motions of a projectile can be treated independently.
sentences.chinese: 抛射体的竖直方向和水平方向的运动能够分开来处理。

sentences.english: Coronal mass ejections have affected power stations in the past.
sentences.chinese: 日冕物质抛射在过去已经影响过发电站的运作。

sentences.english: Catapults, yes yes. I know Roman uses it.
sentences.chinese: 抛射装置，对，对，我知道罗马有这些东西。

sentences.english: This will let the projectile move under other units.
sentences.chinese: 这个标签将会让抛射体在其他单位下方移动。

definition: to throw sth a long distance/to hurl/to throw at/to throw (dice etc)/to flip (a coin)
to shoot (a projectile)/to fire (a rocket)/to launch/to emit (a particle)/to discharge/emanation/emission
